intent: Added release workflow and pre-built binary installation instructions
reasoning_trace:
Created a complete release pipeline so users can install lore without needing Rust/Cargo.

Release Workflow (.github/workflows/release.yml):
- Triggers on version tags (v*)
- Builds for 5 targets:
  - Linux x86_64 and ARM64
  - macOS x86_64 (Intel) and ARM64 (Apple Silicon)
  - Windows x86_64
- Uses matrix strategy for parallel builds
- Cross-compiles Linux ARM64 using gcc-aarch64-linux-gnu
- Creates GitHub Release with all binaries attached
- Uses softprops/action-gh-release for release creation

Installation Instructions:
- README.md: Added platform-specific sections with curl commands
- docs/index.html: Created a 3-column grid layout for macOS/Linux/Windows
- Direct download links using GitHub's /releases/latest/download/ URL pattern
- Windows gets a download button since curl isn't as common there
- Kept 'build from source' as a fallback option for developers

Key decisions:
1. Used /usr/local/bin as install location (standard, usually in PATH)
2. Named binaries with platform suffix for clarity in releases
3. Used 'latest' URL so docs don't need updating for each release
4. Included both x86_64 and ARM64 for Linux/macOS to cover all modern hardware

rejected_alternatives.name: Homebrew formula (requires maintaining a tap, more complexity)
Install script that auto-detects platform (adds complexity, curl to binary is simpler)
cargo binstall support (still requires cargo toolchain)
